channel.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
channel.description:
Here in the United States, the government is mulling over the idea of repealing "Don't Ask, Don't Tell". For those unfamiliar with this, here's a bit of history:
During the President Clinton administration, a law was passed called "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" which said that homosexuals could serve in the military if, and only if, it's not revealed that they are homosexual. If they say they are (or, weirdly enough, someone outs them), they are discharged from the military.
President Obama has stated that one of his goals is to repeal DADT and allow homosexuals to serve openly in the military (i.e., they cannot be discharged simply for having it revealed that they're homosexual).
I'd like to hear perspectives on this from both the American side and from people in other countries.
I'll provide my perspective a little later but I want to hear from you guys first. :slight_smile:

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: Idi
item.description:
Imagine the scene: The desert is on fire, the sky glows a beautiful deep orange. “Movement in that bush… Foot mobile, 90 yards.” “Engaging.” “Roger that” You center your sights on the tiny figure silhouetted against the fury of god. Click Click. “Motherfucker’s Jammed” You yell, hoping the panic isn’t showing in your voice. you pull the cover and dig around for the obstruction, finding it almost immediately. “It’s… its beautiful” The rock is as big as your tooth twinkles with every passing tracer round. The inscription on the band reads “My Hearts And Minds”. You feel a figure slide up through the hatch behind you. As those powerful reassuring hands slide round your face and over your eyes you feel your anxiety melt away. “Sir! I do, Sir.” "still covering your eyes with one hand he slams the gun closed with the other. You pull the trigger. As the 8 year old pashtun girl is torn in two by 50cal 90 yards away two become one as he slides the ring onto your finger.

Read full topic

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
I wonder what the real-life implications of DADT are…

Imagine 6 soldiers in a bar, drinking beer. One of them says: “Oh, wow, guys, gotta tell ya, yesterday I fucked a nice pussy. She was awesome!” Is that OK? Can a heterosexual reveal such detail from his sex life?
Then another says: “Oh, yeah, I had a pussy like that 5 days ago. She was great!”
The story goes around the table, until it reaches the last, 6th guy. He doesn’t say anything.
Now the question is: Which of the 6 soldiers has/have violated the DADT? It’s obvious the 6th guy is gay, yet he didn’t speak.

Read full topic

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Hope you’re not referring to me, Acristoff, because those posts I made are actually arguments I’ve read against DADT, nearly verbatim. Whether those that are making such arguments actually are serving or have served in the military, I don’t know, but the “gays is uncontrollable!” is a very real (though extraordinarily moronic) argument on the other side.

Read full topic

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: Acristoff
item.description:
Why do some of you have such a negative view of everyone who serves in the military? They aren’t all gun-toting rednecks that rape children and can count to potato.

Read full topic

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I promised to provide my perspective on it so here we go:

I have not seen any valid reason to deny homosexuals from serving openly in the military. I’ve heard many invalid reasons (“he’ll look at my dick in the shower!” or “he might rape me in the middle of the night” or “I can’t trust that fgt” or “it’ll affect morale and unit cohesiveness in some vague and undefinable fashion”) but those are mere excuses.

I say, if they want to serve and potentially risk their lives in the course of duty, I don’t see a reason to say “No, you can’t.”

Read full topic

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
It takes a higher level of intellect to make love to the internet and remain straight.

Much, much higher, considering the amount of stuff you can fap to.

And I’m not calling myself smart, just straight and proud, even though it seems like a disability on the internet these days.

And ontopic: I think the “DADT” law should be abolished. Not supporting faggotry, but either way you put it, doesn’t add up. Because only physical training can select those who are truly fit for war, not some stupid idea that if you love same sex you can’t do something.

Read full topic

item.title: Don't Ask, Don't Tell
item.dc:creator: Frozen_Cham
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Frozen: If you’re telling the truth, let me ask you two questions:
Should we pass laws based upon what we personally and individually find “disgusting”?
[COLOR=‘Lime’]If so, can I pass laws against you for your disgusting habit of being unduly focused on the sex lives of others?

If you’re trolling, well played, sir.

Yes, you can.

but, however, if you didn’t read several posts before, I have apologized for my disgusting acting around this area (even though it was a trolling, why shouldn’t I say an apology?).

Read full topic
